meanings.definition: To deceive or outsmart someone through cunning or cleverness.
meanings.sent1: She was outtricking her opponent in the chess game by setting up a clever trap.
meanings.sent2: The detective was known for outtricking criminals with his sharp wit and quick thinking.
meanings.sent3: The magician outtricked the audience by making the coin disappear and reappear in his pocket.
meanings.sent4: The fox outtricked the hunter by leading him on a false trail and escaping into the woods.
meanings.sent5: Outtricking requires thinking ahead and planning your moves carefully to outsmart your opponent.

meanings.definition: The act of outsmarting or deceiving someone through cunning or cleverness.
meanings.sent1: His outtricking of the security system allowed him to access the building undetected.
meanings.sent2: The outtricking of his classmates earned him the reputation of being the cleverest in the school.
meanings.sent3: The outtricking of the rival team in the final game secured their victory and the championship.
meanings.sent4: Her outtricking of the con artist saved her from falling for his scam and losing her money.
meanings.sent5: The art of outtricking involves using your intelligence and wit to outsmart others in various situations.
